title: Frozen Heart would be more appealing if it provided health.
body:
If we traded some of Frozen Heart's stats for health to put it in line with other tank's itemization, it could easily become a niche counterpart to Randuin's Omen and Thornmail for tanks who want to protect their team and not just themselves.

The item that is currently the closest to Frozen Heart functionally is Abyssal Mask, which provides health, mana, magic resist, and a debuff aura that strengthens allies by debuffing nearby enemies. If we shape Frozen Heart up to be an armor counterpart to Abyssal Mask, we get something that looks like this:

{{item:3110}}
**Frozen Heart**
+350 health
+50 armor
+300 mana
+10% CDR
UNIQUE Aura: Reduces attack speed of nearby enemies.
UNIQUE Passive - Eternity: Damage taken from champions is gained as mana. Spending mana restores health.
{{item:3082}} + {{item:3010}} 

I think it would be cool to have an armor counterpart to Abyssal Mask with the Eternity passive to turn tanks durability into mana sustain. It would still be a niche item, but more universally appealing, and unless Riot changes its passive so that it no longer has to compete with other Warden's Mail upgrades, this is about the best we can hope for.

Thoughts?

replies.body:

Passive- abilities apply a stack of glacial freeze on target or targets, each stack slows the enemies movement speed by 15% per stack. up to 3 stacks or 45%.  Lasts 2seconds, reapplication refreshes duration.
Passive- Reduces the attack speed of nearby enemies


I like the idea of it being a Tanks Frozen Mallet, or Ryalis

Since I always use the item in conjunction with {{item:3812}} and {{item:3065}} , I'd much rather it give more armor. 100 or 110. The unique passive is fine as-is since it combines with the other {{item:3082}} upgrades, but the other two upgrades are what I think could use adjustments.

Currently, {{item:3075}} and {{item:3143}}  together are really gold inefficient for the redundant passives, but are often too necessary for lifesteal and crits of marksmen. To combat this, it would be nice to see each of the two offer something extra from the passive, so the best of both apply when stacked.

{{item:3075}} is still weak compared to bramblevest, so it could stand to have its coldsteel apply a stronger attack speed slow. It's meant to strrongly discourage attacking its wearer afterall. Give it a 30% AS slow when procced.

{{item:3143}} has an active movement speed slow, so maybe give its coldsteel a 15% movement speed slow when procced as well.

With this, all three {{item:3082}} items could be used without wasting gold.
Would love to see it be a bit more expensive and build out of tear honestly.

I feel like that would alienate the item even more. Having to stack the mana passive would make it an even more inferior pick to Iceborn Gauntlet as an early item. Tanks buy their way out of their mana problems by taking IBG and get some waveclear as a bonus. If they're running into an AP-heavy comp, they'll take Abyssal Mask.

When tanks are considering how they'll manage their spell costs, they're taking more immediate benefits. Why take a AS slow aura before teamfights start when you could get bonuses that are more impactful in lane/jungle and then buy a different Warden's Mail item once your earlygame is sorted out?
Should rework it to give some kind of stacking movement speed decrease, up to a cap.  Maybe attack speed as well.  Make it more of an interesting item.
No. Not all Armor items for tanks need to provide Armor and Health at the same time. It is bad enough that all MR items do.
Nobody builds Frozen heart. The meta favors items that provide two durability stats.
